reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22629, 'name': 'Michal Nasiadka', 'email': 'mnasiadka@gmail.com', 'username': 'mnasiadka'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23717, 'name': 'Surya Prakash Singh', 'email': 'singh.surya64mnnit@gmail.com', 'username': 'SuryaPrakash'}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-01-23 15:33:51.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/template/filters.py'], 'message': 'Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)

subject: Elasticsearch: Update dependencies for components
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-21 18:41:33.000000000', 'files': ['elasticsearch/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Elasticsearch: Update dependencies for components

This updates the dependencies for the Elasticsearch chart to be
more cautious before proceeding. For example, this updates the
dependencies for the register snapshot job to wait until all
ES components have registered endpoints, and also updates the helm
test pod to wait for all components to have registered endpoints
and the snapshot job to have completed

Change-Id: Ie4e92bba4ae33b33cadb921bdda91ceb813e29e1
'}]
commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Update dependencies for components

This updates the dependencies for the Elasticsearch chart to be
more cautious before proceeding. For example, this updates the
dependencies for the register snapshot job to wait until all
ES components have registered endpoints, and also updates the helm
test pod to wait for all components to have registered endpoints
and the snapshot job to have completed

Change-Id: Ie4e92bba4ae33b33cadb921bdda91ceb813e29e1

commit_message:
Container image config file for builds optional

Make the config option optional for the container image build process.
In previous releases we have shipped a basic yaml file that contains the
list of container to build. We have moved to generating using a jinja
file instead which we ship so we don't need to manage this static file
going forward.

Change-Id: Id689c54f393affe103082e329efaf4ebf376e397
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639846/

subject: Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25618, 'name': 'Paweł Suder', 'email': 'pawel@suder.info', 'username': 'SuderPawel'}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-07 09:45:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126
(cherry picked from commit d471a85931d6f6495efdb8ff43bf903e3e1d639d)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126
(cherry picked from commit d471a85931d6f6495efdb8ff43bf903e3e1d639d)

commit_message:
Undercloud - ironic inspector - host routes

Configure the host_routes specified for subnets
in undercloud.conf as classless static routes
in ironic inspectors dnsmasq configuration.

The advanced routing options will be pushed to
the inspection ramdisk similar to the way they
are already pushed to ironic-python-agent.

Related-Bug: #1819464
Depends-On: I2229d386bff8ae63e4efe8406770b2b378a1991f
Change-Id: I1afb720ae4ee4ce586c16a440e8edf8c2b23e155

subject: Do not install linux-image-extra by default
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-07-24 14:46:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/vars/ubuntu.yml', 'deploy-guide/source/targethosts-prepare.rst'], 'message': 'Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I70fa446c2dd00e12702280388299d189e0f3e5c4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585376/
Closes-Bug: 1783342
'}]
commit_message:
Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I70fa446c2dd00e12702280388299d189e0f3e5c4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585376/
Closes-Bug: 1783342

This is a necessary feature release off the stein branch because our

which is now used in Ubuntu Bionic. The only change in this release

commit_message:
oslo.db 4.45.0

This is a necessary feature release off the stein branch because our
previous lower-constraint on psycopg2 does not work with postgresql 10,
which is now used in Ubuntu Bionic. The only change in this release
is to bump the minimum version of psycopg2 to one that does work
with postgresql 10.

Change-Id: I8d63fd0de8159b561314753d01e37384d73d58f3
Related-Bug: 1821400

Fix README for Duplicate implicit target name: "storyboard"

While releasing new version in pypi, it perform the
validation on the package and give error if there is any
formatting issue.

warning: check: Duplicate implicit target name: "storyboard".
error: Please correct your package.

- http://logs.openstack.org/68/645868/1/check/openstack-tox-validate/9d9219e/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-22_20_15_40_332673

This commit fixes the format error to release the patrole.

Change-Id: Ie840743b61bab5c833f554bb40b6a162e790a29f

subject: Default ControlPlaneMtu to 1500
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-14 14:53:41.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/role.role.j2.yaml'], 'message': 'Default ControlPlaneMtu to 1500

As a follow up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635622/, this also
defaults the value for mtu to 1500 when using DeployedServerPortMap.

Previously, the value was getting set to "0" since it did not get set in
the output. While the "0" value showed up in
/etc/os-net-config/config.json, it didn't actually break anything since
os-net-config has code that only set MTU with "if interface.mtu ...",
and 0 evaluated to False, so it assumed it wasn't set.

With this patch the value will be properly defaulted to 1500 though.

Change-Id: I12d110d653a77bef87d06b4713704844a46b065d
'}]
commit_message:
Default ControlPlaneMtu to 1500

As a follow up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635622/, this also
defaults the value for mtu to 1500 when using DeployedServerPortMap.

Previously, the value was getting set to "0" since it did not get set in
the output. While the "0" value showed up in
/etc/os-net-config/config.json, it didn't actually break anything since
os-net-config has code that only set MTU with "if interface.mtu ...",
and 0 evaluated to False, so it assumed it wasn't set.

With this patch the value will be properly defaulted to 1500 though.

Change-Id: I12d110d653a77bef87d06b4713704844a46b065d

Switches the prepending of "timeout <value>" to the ansible-playbook
command until after ansible-playbook-command.sh has been written.

There's no need to write the command to the reprodcuer script with the

commit_message:
Remove timeout from ansible-playbook-command.sh

Switches the prepending of "timeout <value>" to the ansible-playbook
command until after ansible-playbook-command.sh has been written.

There's no need to write the command to the reprodcuer script with the
timeout command as well, as it creates for a poor experience when using
the script (can't Ctrl-C, etc).

Change-Id: I2e002cd0bfc9fe1f3c0a70b80c40f4728d7c1785

commit_message:
Remove ENV parameters for nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py

With [1] nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py was reworked to get env
details from nova.conf. Therefore we do not need to pass the ENV
vars.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-23 15:04:06.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/customize_image.sh'], 'message': "Don't customize image before upload it to Glance by default

Commit [1] provided new possibility to customize e.g. Ubuntu
image and e.g. install some additional packages just before
upload it to Glance in Devstack's stack.sh script.
It was done to be able to install e.g. socat package to test
multicast.
But until now we don't have tests which would use this and
this customization causes sometimes job failures when
there is package and index mismatch.

So there is no need to customize image always by default.
If we will need to use this customization, we should use
OpenStack's infra mirrors of Ubuntu repositories and then
enable this option for job where its needed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573702/

Change-Id: Ie84c0ae56dbd42cd522c4258903b7eafb435004f
Closes-Bug: #1821384
"}]
commit_message:
Don't customize image before upload it to Glance by default

Commit [1] provided new possibility to customize e.g. Ubuntu
image and e.g. install some additional packages just before
upload it to Glance in Devstack's stack.sh script.
It was done to be able to install e.g. socat package to test
multicast.
But until now we don't have tests which would use this and
this customization causes sometimes job failures when
there is package and index mismatch.

So there is no need to customize image always by default.
If we will need to use this customization, we should use
OpenStack's infra mirrors of Ubuntu repositories and then
enable this option for job where its needed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573702/

Change-Id: Ie84c0ae56dbd42cd522c4258903b7eafb435004f
Closes-Bug: #1821384

commit_message:
Update system grant policies for system member

This commit ensures users with the ``member`` role on the system can
perform read-only operations against the system assignment API.

 - system admin functionality
 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I834475da2343ba87fb169689f71d4cb4713f6786
Related-Bug: 1805368
Related-Bug: 1750669
Related-Bug: 1806762

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-22 03:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Stop running tempest-multinode-full

The job was added to nova with change:

  05ab017907376cc262887104556b01fee18db0c2

As I explained in the mailing list [1], we should
have sufficient test coverage in other voting jobs
that run against nova changes with the use of the
tempest-full-py3, tempest-slow-py3, nova-next, and
nova-(grenade)live-migration jobs. The tempest-full
and nova-next jobs are single-node jobs which run
compute API tests and some scenario tests but no
slow tests and no live migration. The tempest-slow
job is multinode and only runs slow tests. The
live migration jobs run live migration tests over
two nodes (and nova-live-migration also runs
evacuate tests). So tempest-multinode-full is
probably mostly redundant, a waste of time and
resources, especially since it's non-voting.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004139.html

Change-Id: Id2f748d4b119002292bda45689472a68254079ee
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running tempest-multinode-full

The job was added to nova with change:

  05ab017907376cc262887104556b01fee18db0c2

As I explained in the mailing list [1], we should
have sufficient test coverage in other voting jobs
that run against nova changes with the use of the
tempest-full-py3, tempest-slow-py3, nova-next, and
nova-(grenade)live-migration jobs. The tempest-full
and nova-next jobs are single-node jobs which run
compute API tests and some scenario tests but no
slow tests and no live migration. The tempest-slow
job is multinode and only runs slow tests. The
live migration jobs run live migration tests over
two nodes (and nova-live-migration also runs
evacuate tests). So tempest-multinode-full is
probably mostly redundant, a waste of time and
resources, especially since it's non-voting.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004139.html

Change-Id: Id2f748d4b119002292bda45689472a68254079ee

subject: Introduce a base yaml parser for all openstack components
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2019-02-21 16:34:47.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'oslo_serialization/tests/test_yamlutils.py', 'oslo_serialization/yamlutils.py'], 'message': 'Introduce a base yaml parser for all openstack components

A lot of openstack components like:
- solum
- tosca-parser
- heat
- murano
- etc...

reimplement theirs own yaml parser for loading and dumping.

These implementations sometimes forgot to use a safe loader
or safe dumper, our implementation use safe by default.

You can deactive safe by passing the argument is_safe to false when
you call oslo_serialization.yamlutils.load or oslo_serialization.yamlutils.dump.

Change-Id: I63e85a2b4fc999e6acac12ae51c2ab8c64bddbc6
Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce a base yaml parser for all openstack components

A lot of openstack components like:
- solum
- tosca-parser
- heat
- murano
- etc...

reimplement theirs own yaml parser for loading and dumping.

These implementations sometimes forgot to use a safe loader
or safe dumper, our implementation use safe by default.

You can deactive safe by passing the argument is_safe to false when
you call oslo_serialization.yamlutils.load or oslo_serialization.yamlutils.dump.

Change-Id: I63e85a2b4fc999e6acac12ae51c2ab8c64bddbc6
Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>

commit_message:
Include openstack/cinderlib in PROJECTS

The openstack/cinderlib repository will be used by third party Cinder
drivers' jobs to run cinderlib functional tests together with tempest
tests.

This adds a conditional based on the branch to include the
openstack/cinderlib repo in the default PROJECTS list on Stein and later
releases.

Change-Id: I41c08164fab4bab81271741c3355ae6c08e67a8d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-05 17:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/install-cinderlib.yaml', '.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Add cinderlib functional tests to LVM job

This patch adds cinderlib functional tests to the
"cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican" job as a post run playbook that
can fail without affecting the job's result.

In the future we may want to add an independent voting job, but for the
time being this approach means that we limit the load on our gate jobs,
as running the functional test on an already deployed system takes less
than a minute, whereas doing a full deployment takes longer.

The cinderlib functional tests are getting their storage configuration
from the existing /etc/cinder/cinder.conf file.

Change-Id: I7d877e2e18288a42fbfbc57b49a4294a2a98b713
'}]
commit_message:
Add cinderlib functional tests to LVM job

This patch adds cinderlib functional tests to the
"cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican" job as a post run playbook that
can fail without affecting the job's result.

In the future we may want to add an independent voting job, but for the
time being this approach means that we limit the load on our gate jobs,
as running the functional test on an already deployed system takes less
than a minute, whereas doing a full deployment takes longer.

The cinderlib functional tests are getting their storage configuration
from the existing /etc/cinder/cinder.conf file.

Change-Id: I7d877e2e18288a42fbfbc57b49a4294a2a98b713

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I258601b7d6888299dca1aa238b4049252ee0c317

subject: Don't use proc in title patterns
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-20 22:33:39.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/type/keystone_user_role_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb'], 'message': "Don't use proc in title patterns

Using a proc in type title patterns causes an error when generating
puppet types for environment isolation. For example, running `puppet
generate types` on a puppet master produces the following error:
```
Error:
/etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/modules/keystone/lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb:
title patterns that use procs are not supported.
```

This commit changes the `project_domain` parameter to always default to
`DEFAULT_DOMAIN` even when using a `<user>::<user_domain>@::<domain>` or
`<user>@::<domain>` title pattern. The only place I could find that
utilized `project_domain` being unset was determining `keystone_domain`
autorequires. The logic was updated to reflect that `project_domain` is
either set or should use the default unless `domain` is set.

Change-Id: Icd29c5aa89ae442ca69cad0411188162462bf6ff
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use proc in title patterns

Using a proc in type title patterns causes an error when generating
puppet types for environment isolation. For example, running `puppet
generate types` on a puppet master produces the following error:
```
Error:
/etc/puppetlabs/code/environments/production/modules/keystone/lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb:
title patterns that use procs are not supported.
```

This commit changes the `project_domain` parameter to always default to
`DEFAULT_DOMAIN` even when using a `<user>::<user_domain>@::<domain>` or
`<user>@::<domain>` title pattern. The only place I could find that
utilized `project_domain` being unset was determining `keystone_domain`
autorequires. The logic was updated to reflect that `project_domain` is
either set or should use the default unless `domain` is set.

Change-Id: Icd29c5aa89ae442ca69cad0411188162462bf6ff

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 21:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'devstack/Vagrantfile'], 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ide1f122e2ecd71edc1840dc598c100c965a47c0e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ide1f122e2ecd71edc1840dc598c100c965a47c0e

Clarify the documentation for pooled Notification Listeners

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I3fae915f8a94622b72fdd7ab09b7bbb83c22a427
